Package: io.vertx.groovy.ext.apex

[Groovy] Class Router

    • io.vertx.groovy.ext.apex.Router

    • A router receives request from an io.vertx.groovy.core.http.HttpServer and routes it to the first matching Route that it contains. A router can contain many routes.

      Routers are also used for routing failures.

        • final Router delegate

      • Constructor Detail

        • Router(Router delegate)

      • Method Detail

        • void accept(HttpServerRequest request)

          This method is used to provide a request to the router. Usually you take request from the io.vertx.groovy.core.http.HttpServer#requestHandler and pass it to this method. The router then routes it to matching routes.

          Parameters:
          request - the request

        • Router clear()

          Remove all the routes from this router

          Returns:
          a reference to this, so the API can be used fluently

        • Route delete()

          Add a route that matches any HTTP DELETE request

          Returns:
          the route

        • Route delete(String path)

          Add a route that matches a HTTP DELETE request and the specified path

          Returns:
          the route
          Parameters:
          path - URI paths that begin with this path will match

        • Route deleteWithRegex(String regex)

          Add a route that matches a HTTP DELETE request and the specified path regex

          Returns:
          the route
          Parameters:
          regex - URI paths that begin with a match for this regex will match

        • Router exceptionHandler(Handler<Throwable> exceptionHandler)

          Specify a handler for any unhandled exceptions on this router. The handler will be called for exceptions thrown from handlers. This does not affect the normal failure routing logic.

          Returns:
          a reference to this, so the API can be used fluently
          Parameters:
          exceptionHandler - the exception handler

        • Route get()

          Add a route that matches any HTTP GET request

          Returns:
          the route

        • Route get(String path)

          Add a route that matches a HTTP GET request and the specified path

          Returns:
          the route
          Parameters:
          path - URI paths that begin with this path will match

        • Object getDelegate()

        • List<Route> getRoutes()

          Returns:
          a list of all the routes on this router

        • Route getWithRegex(String regex)

          Add a route that matches a HTTP GET request and the specified path regex

          Returns:
          the route
          Parameters:
          regex - URI paths that begin with a match for this regex will match

        • void handleContext(RoutingContext context)

          Used to route a context to the router. Used for sub-routers. You wouldn't normally call this method directly.

          Parameters:
          context - the routing context

        • void handleFailure(RoutingContext context)

          Used to route a failure to the router. Used for sub-routers. You wouldn't normally call this method directly.

          Parameters:
          context - the routing context

        • Route head()

          Add a route that matches any HTTP HEAD request

          Returns:
          the route

        • Route head(String path)

          Add a route that matches a HTTP HEAD request and the specified path

          Returns:
          the route
          Parameters:
          path - URI paths that begin with this path will match

        • Route headWithRegex(String regex)

          Add a route that matches a HTTP HEAD request and the specified path regex

          Returns:
          the route
          Parameters:
          regex - URI paths that begin with a match for this regex will match

        • Router mountSubRouter(String mountPoint, Router subRouter)

          Mount a sub router on this router

          Returns:
          a reference to this, so the API can be used fluently
          Parameters:
          mountPoint - the mount point (path prefix) to mount it on
          subRouter - the router to mount as a sub router

          Add a route that matches any HTTP OPTIONS request

          Returns:

        • Route route()

          Add a route with no matching criteria, i.e. it matches all requests or failures.

          Returns:
          the route

        • Route route(HttpMethod method, String path)

          Add a route that matches the specified HTTP method and path

          Returns:
          the route
          Parameters:
          method - the HTTP method to match
          path - URI paths that begin with this path will match

        • Route route(String path)

          Add a route that matches the specified path

          Returns:
          the route
          Parameters:
          path - URI paths that begin with this path will match

          the route

          regex - URI paths that begin with a match for this regex will match
